definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: It is thus possible that aperitifs may have sometimes preceded the first course in England.
sentences.chinese: 因此，在英國開胃酒可能在第一道菜之前上桌。

sentences.english: An aperitif or some white wine？
sentences.chinese: 一份開胃酒還是一些白葡萄酒？

sentences.english: Would you like to order aperitif?
Dry and fruity , lovely as an aperitif.
sentences.chinese: 烈的有水果味，可愛的開胃酒。

sentences.english: Brut is very good as an aperitif.
sentences.chinese: 是很好的餐前開胃酒，非常適合慶典場合飲用。

sentences.english: You can enjoy an aperitif or you can chat over a night-cap before bed.
sentences.chinese: 您可以享受開胃酒或者可以睡前聊天。

sentences.english: As an aperitif, mussels marinieres, crab cocktail, seafood, or dessert.
sentences.chinese: 可以作爲開胃酒，也可以與海鮮或甜品搭配。
世界著名的希臘開胃酒。

sentences.english: Would you care for an aperitif before you meal?
sentences.chinese: 進餐前您要不要來杯開胃酒？

sentences.english: Best Serve chilled as an aperitif or dessert wine.
sentences.chinese: 冰凍後作餐前開胃酒或餐後獨飲。

sentences.english: What kind of drinks do you have for aperitif?
By the time he has finished, it is the hour of the apéritif.
sentences.chinese: 待他做完這一切，就到喝開胃酒的時候了。

sentences.english: Perfect as an aperitif and with hors -d'oeuvres. Serve well chilled.
sentences.chinese: 作爲開胃酒或搭配乾果，冰鎮後飲用更佳。

sentences.english: Good evening, sir. Would you care for an aperitif before your meal?
sentences.chinese: 先生，晚上好。進餐前要不要來點開胃酒？
